note.p: Birth: Cheetham Hill, near Manchester, Cheshire, England (18 December 1856)
Death: Cambridge (30 August 1940)
Burial: Nave, Westminster Abbey, London
Research Field: Physics
Education: Owen's College, Manchester; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1880)

Career: Fellow and Lecturer of Trinity College, Cambridge; Professor of Natural Philosophy, Royal Institution, London; Cavendish Professor of Physics, Cambridge (1884-1918); Master of Trinity College, Cambridge (1918)
Honours: Kt 1908; OM 1912
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 12/06/1884
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1894; Hughes Medal 1902; Copley Medal 1914; Nobel Prize (Physics) 1906
Lectures: Bakerian 1887, 1913
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB
Anniversary Address 1920 in Proceedings of the Royal Society A 98 1920-21 pp319-328
AssocMaterial: CSAC 74/4/80; NCUACS 91/4/00; NCUACS 117/3/03. Papers deposited in Trinity College Library, Cambridge
